page.title: 02The Derwent Walk
page.content: The Derwent Walk follows the track bed of the former Derwent Valley Railway between Swalwell Station Site and Blackhill, Consett. The line,which was opened in 1867 and closed in 1962,was purchased and developed by Durham County Council as a footpath,bridleway and cycle track in 1972. When the railway closed the rails and some bridges were removed. Some stretches became impassable; others were used as local walks. The lower Derwent Valley is a well wooded,{highly attractive}area with considerable wildlife interest. For most of it's length the walk is flanked by trees, shrubs and a variety of wild flowers. The Derwent Walk is used for different activities. These include: picnic areas and sponsored walks.
